**NOTE THIS CHANGE:

Parents:

There have recently been incidents on our campus of students and/or parents almost being hit by cars passing thru to drop off children. In an effort to keep our students as safe as possible, we are closing the second traffic lane, and the parking spaces directly to the west of the bus lanes. If you feel that you need to walk your child inside, please park in the teacher parking, and walk your child to the front door.

Those spaces will also be closed in the afternoons, so plan to pull behind the buses to pick up your children. Their safety is our utmost concern. Thank you for your flexibility, and for making our students a priority.

Red Ribbon Week - Oct. 28th-Nov. 1

This year we are doing Red Ribbon Week a little different. Instead of dress up days, we are focusing on positively noticing others and being kind in order to give people reasons to stay drug free. Those who feel noticed and accepted are less likely to do drugs. Each day we will have drawings and activities to go along with the day's theme.

Name Tag Monday
Everyone has a name, why not learn it? Wear a name tag all day and discover names of the many faces you see daily. Be sure to greet everyone by their name!

T-Shirt Tuesday
Wear your favorite t-shirt! Learn why others chose their shirt and find out who might share your same interests!

Guess Who Wednesday
Focus on what others might need - a simple smile, hug or kind word can go a long way. Leave a random note of encouragement in someone's locker or cubby.

Halloween
Say BOO to drugs! Dress in your costume, but don't let drugs make you scary!

Feel Good Friday
Everyone likes to hear nice compliments, so practice treating others the way you want to be treated!

In mind for the new 2019-2020 school year:

• Cell phones are not permitted in the classrooms, bathrooms, or hallways.

• Headphones and ear buds are not allowed in the classrooms, bathrooms, or hallways.

• Phones and headphones/ear buds will be taken up and returned at the end of the day for a $15 fee if they are being used during the day.

Copies of the handbook and code of conduct will be available closer to the first day of school and will be available online.

March 20, 2019 at 12:55 PM · Lubbock, TX ·

“Never too late to do the right thing.“

Pleasure having Elaine Snyder Gibson with her Family Consumer Science class from Hermleigh ISD at Fuddruckers.

Elaine has a passion for preparing kids for the real world and Make A Difference in the kids lives.

She is helping kids get ready for a career and/or go to college with restaurant experience. Her definetion of hospitality is to make people feel happy, feel welcome and needs are met. Also need humility to be restaurant industry and do everything to the best of your ability.

Favorite quote from her dad: Never too late to do the right thing!!!
